comments: Published seroprevalence estimates. Set own threshold for positivity: OD/CI >= 1.5

manufacturer: Wantai Biological Pharmacy Enterprise Co., Ltd., Beijing, China
positive_validation_samples: PCR-confirmed COVID-19 patients admitted to Dutch intensive care units in March 2020,  (n=10; 9/10 seropositive; 1/10 seronegative), (iii) Dutch PCR-confirmed COVID-19 patients with only mild symptoms (n=11; 11/11 seropositive), (iv) Dutch plasma donors with a documented PCR-positive test result who were at least 14 days fully recovered from mild or moderate COVID-19 symptoms

test_name: VivaDiag COVID?19 IgM/IgG Rapid Test lateral flowimmunoassay (LFIA
ref: Cassaniti I, Novazzi F, Giardina F, Salinaro F, Sachs M, Perlini S, et al. Performance of VivaDiag COVID-19. IgM/IgG Rapid Test is inadequate for diagnosis of COVID-19 in acute patients referring to emergency room department. Journal of medical virology. DOI: 10.1002/jmv.25800
positive_validation_samples: Thirty COVID?19?positive patients (25 M/5 F; median age, 73.5; range, 38?86 years)admitted to the Infectious Diseases Department or at the In-tensive Care Unit were tested as positive controls.
negative_validation_samples: 30 healthy volunteers with documented ne-gative results for COVID?19 RT?PCR in respiratory samples
comments: positive control samples only 7 days post PCR test, so sensitivity might be higher longer after. I counted weakly positive tests plus tests positive for either Igg or Igm, which the Iran study did not. Showed poor sensitivity in newly admitted acute patients - I did not use these results as they are too soon after onset.
seroprevalence from news report, test unknown

test_name: ELISA detecting antibodies to spike protein
positive_validation_samples: Seven control samples from contract-traced individuals who were PCRconfirmed as SARS-Cov-2 infected were used as positive controls in the study. All the individuals from whom the positive control sera samples were taken had asymptomatic SARS-CoV-2 infections
negative_validation_samples: 100 blood  donor samples were tested in parallel from the Scottish National Blood Transfusion Service (SNBTS) anonymous archive collected between September 2018 and December 2019

comments: already adjusted in the seroprevalence presented

manufacturer: Wadsworth Center (NY public health lab)/Sino Biological
comments: Two different serology tests used, appear to be comparable. Validation study details: https://www.medrxiv.org/content/medrxiv/suppl/2020/05/29/2020.05.25.20113050.DC1/2020.05.25.20113050-1.pdf

test_name: Screening Ig ELISA with reflex ELISA confirmatory assay
comments: Forced to "back calculate" because raw positive and negative counts not provided

manufacturer:
Euroimmun SARS-CoV-2
IgG ELISA; Roche Elecsys Anti-SARS-CoV-2; Mikrogen recomWell ELISA
comments: Raw numbers are not provided for any sensitivity metrics. In addition specificity is ambigious due to the use of three tests without a clear criterion for case inclusion. Sensitivity is based on a web search of serological test brands

positive_validation_samples: known PCR-positive COVID-19 patients with positive IgG or IgM detected on a locally-developed ELISA test
comments: Updated preprint. There is more data from the manufacturers if we want it

Authors state that: "pooling the results from the four validation studies, weighted by sample sizes, sensitivity is estimated at 84.8% (95% CI 81.4%;87.8%) and specificity at 99.0% (95% CI 97.8%;99.7%)."
